alert.note: Alert for Meade (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:35AM CDT until July 10 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Crooked Creek Near Englewood affecting Meade County. For the Crooked Creek...including Englewood...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Crooked Creek Near Englewood. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Prepare for minor inundations of one or more feet along the Crooked Creek in southern Meade County as floodwaters leave the main channel and moves out onto the floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 6.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.8 feet on 05/30/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
